website_summaries.verdict: A practical fan that delivers straightforward oscillation and ample airflow. The best choice for the budget-minded consumer.
pros: Impressive air circulation for a budget price
Head tilts back to provide targeted airflow
The base is adjustable, and assembly requires no tools
cons: It doesn't have fancy features like more expensive models, but you won't miss them if saving money is your top concern

customer_reviews.title: Simple, loud and just what I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a loud fan, odd request you may think but I like fan noise when I sleep. This thing does the job and on the lowest setting it is not overpoweringly loud but you know it is there. It is a lightweight piece and assembles easily. It was what I wanted and the price was nice. Now I did put a speed control on it that I had laying around and that did dial it back a bit, winter fan usage is not the best thing but it does circulate the warmer air. The lowest setting is more like a medium on some other fans so take this into account.
customer_reviews.author: Kevan

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I am buying another one because I like this one so much. Very powerful/perfect on medium and perfect on low as well. Haven't tried high because I get cold on medium/low! It blows far and is pretty quiet. I am sensitive to noise and I can tune it out pretty well. It's not heavy so I take it room to room with me on hot days. The only issue I have is tightening the stand height. Sometimes when I push the button to oscillate, the whole thing goes down because it's difficult for me to tighten the leg. That's nothing to the comfort it brings to the air in the house though. Glad we purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: Useless The remote was missing. The plastic was all warped and wouldn't assemble. Not even a little bit. The motor, the stand, and the base are all in good condition, but its useless without the protecting plastic. Little kids and pets can get caught in there without it, and that can be very dangerous. I had an old Lasko fan that had wire protection instead of plastic, so I replaced the plastic for the wire. I'm not to happy with that, though because the old fan still works..... I would return it, but last time I tried to return something during the pandemic, I didn't get a refund. I'm very displeased with Amazon at the moment. It's all very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Karol C

customer_reviews.title: Listen to the other reviewers
customer_reviews.text: Edit: bought this 5/27/2020 and it’s completely broken by 7/16/2020. Would give negative starts if I could. Changed from 3 to 1 stars I love and trust my fellow Amazon reviewers. It is a piece of crap. The air flows strong and I appreciate white noise but it’s just a little too loud and it’s already broken and won’t stay up. Easy to put together but it’s flimsy and cheap and not as good as the one I got at Costco for the same price...also Lasko. Not worth returning and fine if you’re desperate but it’s the fan you almost throw away but keep because it does move a lot of air and you will just keep it for emergencies.
customer_reviews.author: 45 year old female

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and flimsy yet powerful
customer_reviews.text: This fan is completely unassembled in the box. There's only about 8 pieces to put together but as you are doing so you can tell it is not of high quality. We like to have a fan for air movement and white noise while sleeping. For those two things it's pretty good. Unfortunately the fan starts clicking and getting out of sync and when that happens while sleeping you definitely notice it. The fan cover was so cheap it fell off in the middle of the night one time. I'd bought other Lasko fans in the past and this was not their finest work. We'll be sending back.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy Merryman

customer_reviews.title: It's just Okay - I've had better
customer_reviews.text: This fan will do the job. Air output is decent, but not as powerful as one would be led to believe by other reviews. Yes, it is all plastic, except the motor and post. The base is super wide ( round ) so be prepared for that. You must have the floor space for it. I kept this purchase, because it will serve it's purposed...but I am not in awe of this fan.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie Maurer

customer_reviews.title: no quality control
customer_reviews.text: For several years, the Lasko fans have been our favorite fans here at our resort. Unfortunately, it seems that something has suddenly changed with the Lasko fans. We just ordered 3 and one was missing the locking ring, so it cannot be used, and all three had faulty plastic covers that the snaps weren't stamped out. We tried using zap straps to hold the covers on. We are very disappointed that Lasko who did make a great product, has neglected their customers and quality control.
customer_reviews.author: D.W.

customer_reviews.title: Smells Like and Electrical Fire
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't expecting anything substantial with this fan. I cannot recommend for two reasons.. It is poorly built and rattles straight out of the box. The most undesirable aspect is the noxious electrical fire smell coming from it's motor. Filled my front room with terrible, unhealthy fumes... Had to actually turn it off.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Too Loud
customer_reviews.text: It does push a lot of air but is very loud even on low. I will post a video. I bought this for my daughters dorm room. Not sure if she will be able to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: You get what you paid for
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to assemble, no tools nor instructions needed. However, when it came to mounting the front cover, that wouldnt stay attached. The little clips just didn’t want to snap in, and stay in place. Overall, this was loud, and didn’t really cool the room. Yes, it shifts some air, but is able to push it maybe 5-10 feet only. Makes too much noise. I learned my lesson - a cheap piece of junk is not what I need. I am returning this, and replacing it with a circulator fan that moves the air in the entire room without having to oscilate (just google this). Rhymes with Tornado. Starts with „v”.
customer_reviews.author: Monni

customer_reviews.title: Beware of defective and damaged product
customer_reviews.text: Check out photos I uploaded. Can't completely assemble what it supposed to be. If you touch once with a little press will drop the frame of the fan. It is completely defective product. Poor quality. Maximum noise. Damaged good. Worst fan purchase ever in my life.
customer_reviews.author: YP

customer_reviews.title: Works well... but cheaply made and annoying sound
customer_reviews.text: Very powerful fan! Very loud... works extremely well. But.. cheaply made. Fan made a terrible sound like a irrigation system water pump. Could not sleep with it on... returned it the day after i got it
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Blasto
customer_reviews.text: It took me almost an hour to put this together. Not because it has complicated instructions, but because aligning and snapping the grill together took me about 45 minutes alone. Now I have the logo crooked, but I am done until I have to clean it. I'm not taking the whole thing apart so I can have an aligned logo. It's is much larger than I expected, but it makes my entire front room nice and fresh. It's August in L.A., so I think I'll get good use out of it. I don't care about noise level. I need the white noise. Most fans are noisy, but I've had noisier.
customer_reviews.author: A. Jarry

customer_reviews.title: Poor packaging and inferior knobs
customer_reviews.text: In trying to expand our outdoor experience this summer I ordered this fan. The first one came with a broken knob for the oscillation. It was not protected in shipping at all. After a long wait to "chat" on the Lasko website they agreed to ship a new fan. When it arrived it also had unprotected knobs. Luckily they were not broken. So... with using needle nose pliers we had 2 fans. Good deal huh? Well...now a second knob has broken. We like the fans, good power, low noise but the poor quality of the knobs is my reason for the 1 star.
customer_reviews.author: kvwilson

customer_reviews.title: Powerful, loud
customer_reviews.text: 1) This is a very powerful fan. "low" is equivalent to "high" on other fans. I wish it had 2 more low settings. 2) This is a loud fan. You wouldn't want it right beside you, but rather across the room. 3) Putting the front cover on the fan housing is torture. You clip one part into place, three other parts clip out of place. You need 5 hands to do it in a timely fashion. 4) Mine had a SERIOUS wobble until I loosened the plastic screw thing that holds the blade assembly to the impeller. Good fan overall, I guess. Wish it was a bit quieter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Price, works perfect
customer_reviews.text: It was exactly what I needed for my outdoor screened-in porch. Great price and works well. The only reason it gets a 4 instead of a 4 is that the fan guard was a bit hard to snap together. Not physically, but the adjustment on where it snaps took a while. I would prefer that they just have some screws. Additionally, it has three speeds. The first setting is the highest than the second-highest then low speed. I think that's backward. I think it should be low med and then the highest speed. Minor things for the price. It works great.
customer_reviews.author: Mark J. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Amazing fan that is quiet yet powerful & super easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I had got a bigger Lasko fan as a gift last summer & I absolutely love it. I just bought another big one for my living room recently and I needed another one for a smaller room, so I decided to buy the smaller version of the big one & I am so happy that I did. I love this brand if fans. They never disappoint. This stand up fan is super easy to assemble, quiet yet powerful and definitely worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Jessica DeSpirito

customer_reviews.title: Noisy!
customer_reviews.text: This thing makes too much noise. I assumed that a bigger fan would make little noise at its lowest setting but this thing at its lowest setting makes more noise than the HT-900 at its highest setting. If it had looked industrial I would have understood but it looks like it supposed to go in your living room. Yes, it moves more air at its lowest than the Honeywell HT-900 at its highestbut I wanted a quiet option...
customer_reviews.author: 'LilRedDog

customer_reviews.title: Returning
customer_reviews.text: I own this type of Lasco fan and had it for years. This was a different model (newer) but not very good at all. Issues out of the box. Broken piece on fan grill. Plastic very flimsy. Plugged it in, noise in the motor but not spinning. Removed grill, blade and screw Gave it a spin and it spinned. Power was not there. On #1 weak #2 weak on #3 feels like how actual #1 should feel. Also the oscillating feature did not work.
customer_reviews.author: geez

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I needed a pedestal fan with a remote control. I read the reviews for all of the fans in this price range and chose this one because it looked as if it was easy to assemble. I stink at putting stuff together so ease of assembly was important to me. There is a “how to” video on the company’s website that was very helpful. I put this together in about 10 minutes. It works. It’s a little noisy but you cannot expect a fan in this price range to be completely silent.
customer_reviews.author: SBJ

customer_reviews.title: Lasted one year!
customer_reviews.text: The motor blew up last night. Thank goodness I was home because it didn't actually shut down. Even though it lasted only 1 year, I ran that thing day and night. It would probably still be around if I didn't run it constantly year round. So, it was a good deal because I beat it up badly and it performed well. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Glenda Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Most powerful fan I’ve ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: This fan is no joke! Without exaggeration, this fan is enough to cool down a large space on its own in the hottest of summer days. In the past we’ve used a few air conditioners through out our home which got expensive. Now we’ve relied on a single AC paired with this fan for circulation and WOW. It really cools down our entire 1100 sq. Ft. space! We even shut everything off at night and just use this fan for night time sleeping. Sometimes it’s actually felt too cold, that’s how good it is! 10/10 recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jack Cleary

customer_reviews.title: No!
customer_reviews.text: Did not come with remote control I have other Lasko fans and they are great! I ordered this one off amazon and its horrible..plastic cheap no remote and it falls apart . The head of the fan does not stay connected...its a horrible product that i paid way too much for. Should have went to the store and bought one.
customer_reviews.author: QueenOfWands

customer_reviews.title: Crap Product!
customer_reviews.text: Missing parts and parts would not correctly fit. Very cheaply made. Stay away from it. Terrible! Moreover, when I went to return it and Amazon would "not" issue a UPS label but I had to return it to a Kohl's Store which is totally inconvenient. I merely tossed the product in the trash as its more costly for me to run around town looking for a Kohl's to drop it off. Very disappointed in Amazon. They went down several notches on my list over this one. N. Rounds
customer_reviews.author: Norman P. Rounds

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: Got fan supper fast. The nut that holds the blade on would not fit. Chatted with Amazon customer service and apparently they were not from the US because they said they were sorry it was not comparable with my electricity. When I explained it was the nut they suggested I take it to a shop for repair! I just get it the day before!
customer_reviews.author: Monkeybutt

customer_reviews.title: Died after one year, no service no warranty....
customer_reviews.text: The fan arrived and was easy to assemble. It is not particularly durable/solid, but it stays upright and worked fine. Controls were good and noise was reasonable. I used it when on a treadmill, so in two years I operated it about 60 times. I was using it this week and it just died with a little electrical smell. Dead. Contacted Lasko but their warranty is only one year and there are no service/replacement options. Ever heard the phrase "buy cheap, buy twice" --think about it and move on from this unit without buying it. Not worth the hassle.
customer_reviews.author: R. V. Croker III

customer_reviews.title: Worst Product Ever
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT - I purchased this item and have tried to use it! As soon as it is plugged in, it starts to smoke - FAKE ITEM! Do not buy this item, I wish I never.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Allison Lewis

customer_reviews.title: 18” is the blade size not the fan.
customer_reviews.text: The 18 inch measurement is the size of the blade not the size of the fan. The housing is21”. It looks nice doesn’t sound Rattalee. It makes a fan moving air noise that I like. I use a sound screen machine and this just adds to that. I’m a light sleeper and need a lot of white noise. AFTER USING IT A MONTH, in the middle of the night the fan blade fell off, holy moly what a startling noise it made. Hopefully it was just a fluke and it won’t happen again !!!! That’s why 4 stars and not 5
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: read reviews before buying
customer_reviews.text: holy crap is this thing loud. not only that, but i had trouble assembling it because the snaps that connect the front grill to the back just were not there at all. im fairly certain i did everything right when assembling, i followed the instructions to a t, but when i tested it, it sputtered and has continued to do so. as in, the level of speed of the movement of the fan blades changes over time, it will get faster, then slower, then faster again. i use this for white noise when i sleep and its pretty annoying.
customer_reviews.author: The Inkling

customer_reviews.title: Not the same quality as the older ones.
customer_reviews.text: Packaged well and easy to assemble. Noisy and cheaply made. Have had several Lasco fans in the past that lasted for years. This one is so noisy that I will have to use it outside. Not worth the trouble to return.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy, junk parts that do not fit correctly.
customer_reviews.text: Made from very light plastic with parts that do not fit correctly. Fan cage does not fit and must be modified to allow fan to spin. Poorly packed for shipment with some packing crushed leaving controls unprotected. Assembly is frustrating and some parts must be twisted, modified or trimmed for proper alignment. This is not worth the price nor would I recommend it even if it were free. Avoid. AMAZON, look closer at what you sell.
customer_reviews.author: History Buff

customer_reviews.title: LOUD
customer_reviews.text: The fan assembles easily, seems reasonably sturdy (mostly plastic) but it's also light-weight which is great. On the lowest setting, this fan outputs considerable airflow but it's also so noisy that I stopped using it after three or four days. The noise comes from the motor (cheap, plastic housing doesn't attenuate any of the noise) and the fan blades themselves. Seems a shame, really, since I spent good money for this and had high hopes. If you need high output and don't care about excessive noise, this is a fan to consider.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not constant
customer_reviews.text: We primarily use a fan for white noise for sleeping. The fan speed is super odd with this fan. When running on low you can actually hear the fan speed changing slightly up and down. It's loud enough that you can hear it over the moving air sound. If this thing wasn't such a pain in the ass to pack back up I'd return it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Okay Fan
customer_reviews.text: I gave a 1 on the remote, as this fan has no remote. I bought this for my wife, who likes the ceiling fan going as well as an additional fan at night. It was fairly easy to assemble. It is definitely not the quietest fan. If you're a daytime sleeper and need it to drown out noise, then this one will do the trick. The fan does move air good.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Moves a lot off air
customer_reviews.text: I use this fan to cool my bedroom because I do not have air conditioning. Even on setting one or two, it keeps me nice and cool on hot summer nights. When the temperature stays above 100 degrees all night, I have to turn the fan up to 3, but then it still does the job. This fan is extremely loud. Like, it is similar to sitting underneath a busy highway bridge. However, the sound is consistent and even, so for me, this works as a neutral white noise. It even helps to drown out the forklifts that operate at the lumber yard across the street starting every morning at 6 am.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan M

customer_reviews.title: plastic fan, the front falls off
customer_reviews.text: This fan is easy to assemble; however, as pictured, there is no way to actually 'lock' the front piece to the back piece. As pictured, the front of the fan often falls off due to this. And, one side was did not even have the 'lock' design.. it is missing. The fan is plastic, which might also play a part in the fan not being able to hold itself together. The breeze it gives off is actually good, but I'm tired of having to put back on the front of the fan only for it to fall off again later. I plan on purchasing something better in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: SL

customer_reviews.title: Super loud but works
customer_reviews.text: The cord is very short. And it is very noisy but it really does move alot of air. I have a room that has a huge arched window facing the sun and that room is always so hot so I needed a fan to push the cool air into the room. This works great but its really loud. I also used zip ties to secure the front of the fan cage on I dont trust it to stay on.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy

customer_reviews.title: Quietest fan we've ever had. Excellent value!!!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly we have stand up fans in each of our bedrooms and until I bought this one for our son's room, I just assumed all fans were loud. This one is whisper quiet. I am now buying another one. I attached a video with sound so you can hear what I'm talking about.
customer_reviews.author: Laura M.

customer_reviews.title: Broken piece limits use of a favorite brand fan
customer_reviews.text: I love Lasko fans, they are powerful, fairly quiet and durable. Unfortunately this one came with the piece that makes the fan stationary, broken. Too much of a bother to send it back when I can use it circulating from side to side. Would not make this type of purchase again as waiting for replacement would take longer than going to a store and exchanging it. With the current pandemic, I prefer less outings hence more online shopping. Heat is unbearable but I’ve learned that certain purchases are not reliable online. This fan was one of them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Moves The Right Amount of Air
customer_reviews.text: Good luck getting the front cover on. Did not realize until I had a it together and was looking for the remote control that I ordered the wrong fan. I'm a little old lady. Give me a break. I said to myself what the heck and kept it as it moves the same amount of air. I am replacing the one with the remote control that lasted seven months. Maybe this one without the remote control will last longer. I like the noise level and amount of air that it moves.
customer_reviews.author: Susan F. Chassee

customer_reviews.title: Great Air Flow, but it is loud, Grills need extra ties etc.
customer_reviews.text: Pro and cons of this fan. Pros: It puts out lots of air, easy to assemble no bolts etc. Cons: the Grins will not stay on without a zip tie or a little wire (not a big deal, but need to know). It is loud, I like it for my bedroom as I like to sleep with noise. I would not want this in the living area. Giving it 4 stars as I like the air flow and the sound for my bedroom (IT IS LOUDER).....
customer_reviews.author: Danny OKC

customer_reviews.title: ... fallen too many times and started to make a funny noise. We use it for both white noise ...
customer_reviews.text: We had to replace our old box fan as it had fallen too many times and started to make a funny noise. We use it for both white noise to help us sleep at night and to cool us down in the summer, so we decided to upgrade to a stand up fan that had the oscillation feature and we are so happy we did! This fan has all the right speeds (not too soft so you can hear your pets running around at night but not too loud so you can't sleep) and it does a great job of cooling us off on these hot summer nights. Great purchase
customer_reviews.author: Sarah D

customer_reviews.title: A great buy; effective, attractive, adjustable and affordable!
customer_reviews.text: I asked my husband, "How do you like your fan?" He replied, "I don't like it, I LOVE it!" I like the all black design with its telescoping post and HUGE blade area! As California is going to become nothing but hotter and drier, this is a great investment. We had to move to a different area because of my health. In the past decade this area has totally changed its once reliable climate. We are renting a house and none of them are prepared for the changing weather with neither heaters nor air conditioners. My spouse loves the cold of Alaska but does not want to live the single life, so this will help him cohabitate with me!
customer_reviews.author: M'ette

customer_reviews.title: Great fan for the price
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful fan. Assembly was a bit tricky, but not so bad as other reviews suggest. Maybe we just got lucky on hole alignment. Fan is loud and powerful. Loud is nice if you need the noise to sleep (I do). The breeze is very strong at 3, most nights I keep it at 1 (the lowest) and it's perfect. it's been 90 the last couple nights, so we kept it at 3 but so far has kept us from needing to put the AC in. It was 97 the other day and we put it in the living room on oscillate and it kept us cool enough that we didn't run to put the AC in. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Logan

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control and lifetime.
customer_reviews.text: I have had a number of versions of this fan and the quality has just gotten worse over time. Today my 8 month old Lasko fan died and I resolved to switch to Honeywell and to see if they have good quality. Lasko - I bought your fans for a long time, but 8 months for a fan to then die? Your quality control is slipping. I don't know what the warranty is for a fan I bought only last January, but this should not have already died like this... I'm off to try Honeywell...
customer_reviews.author: Jon Almada

customer_reviews.title: Avoid Lasko fans. Nothing but issues.
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE (02/17/19) Delivered Nov.16 and broke yesterday 02/16/19. Started to rattle very badly and went to examine and found the thread lock ring had wiggles loose over time. Now to avoid over-tightening a plastic part, come to find it actually already cracked and completely broke. Makes noise, not a very sturdy fan. Very plastic feeling, very loud. Even on lowest setting. Not happy with this fan.
customer_reviews.author: AyRoby

customer_reviews.title: Keeps me cool and comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I did not receive a remote control with it. I still gave it five stars because it really blows a lot of cool air and does the job! Just the perfect amount of noise for white noise so I can sleep well at night without being bothersome. Excellent instructions and easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Picarelli

customer_reviews.title: Excellent power
customer_reviews.text: The fan is a bit big, but it covers larger areas than most fans in that price range. It's super quiet and has a ton of power to cool down a nice sized room. Only draw back is that the stand is a tad wobbly but for the price, it's a bargain!! I'd definitely buy this one again.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Coladonato, CPA

customer_reviews.title: This is COOL!
customer_reviews.text: Any fan makes noise. This one is moderate. But, boy can it move some air on a hot day! Very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Everett

customer_reviews.title: Positive Amazon Reviews For the Win... AGAIN!
customer_reviews.text: MOST IMPORTANT Air Flow: Much more than the price suggests Noise: Comparable to most other fans that put out less air. BONUSES * So easy to assemble that there aren't even parts to clasp together the safety protector around the blade. The plastic snaps securely into place. * Controls are simple and intuitive but slightly different than others I have seen, portraying a slightly modern feel. HEIGHT *Will satisfy most users. I put it on a table to add additional height to cycle the hot air that gets trapped at the top of the room. On a table, it is over 6" tall. I might put it on something even higher for my intended use.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk

customer_reviews.title: Great fans for the price.
customer_reviews.text: We have bought many different types of fans over years. I'll be the first to say that some are too cheap and some too expensive. Lasko fans fit right in the middle. For the fan you get it works as it is one you'd pay x2 the price for. We try to prolong the time we need to turn on the ac in our house (1700 sqft), so we have 4 fans running. I highly recommend this brand as it has lasted our family years and we just had to replace the standing fan after 7 years. Great fans!
customer_reviews.author: testing123

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastic
customer_reviews.text: Cheapest plastic blades I have ever seen and doubt they can do the job. I didn’t assemble yet and might have to return. I usually like Lasko but this isn’t worth $5. I could have bought a fan at dollar general. Blame myself and CoVid for not going to the store.
customer_reviews.author: Lori241

customer_reviews.title: *Nearly* as advertised. Still great value for money.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. Moves a TON of air. Not as quiet as advertised though. I have the same company in a 4 blade fan. That one wasn't touted as being quiet. They are about the same volume when at their highest settings. This one, however, is noticeably better at moving air and thus, cooling a room. I'll be getting two more for my guys at the warehouse this summer. I recommend this with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very loud and not for bed room
customer_reviews.text: The "quiet, energy efficient" in the description is a lie, this fan is very loud even on low, and it uses 62.5 Watt on low and over 90 watt on high. This fan is not for bedroom usage, as it's way too loud and the oscillation speed is way too fast. I am sitting 2 feet away from it and I can barely feel anything before it moves away from me.
customer_reviews.author: singjipie

customer_reviews.title: Ordered new fan but got a used fan.
customer_reviews.text: I paid for a new fan. I got a used fan. Re-Packaged very poorly. Had all the parts but very scratched up. Nothing was in plastic and the cord was all tangled. Very disappointed! I put it together so I am not returning it. Would be too difficult to take apart.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy Wooten

customer_reviews.title: Cheap material, front fan cover pops off.
customer_reviews.text: Piece of crap. As soon as I got it I opened it and went to assemble it and realized the cheap plastic material and the front fan cover doesn't even snap on right. It kept popping off. I disassembled it and packaged it right back up. I have a 1 year old and a 4 year old I'm not having a fan that the covers pops off. It's not even safe
customer_reviews.author: Isaac Torres Jr

customer_reviews.title: Best fan ever!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this fan because I get so hot at night and needed a fan to keep me cool so I can sleep. This fan works so well it has three speeds but I only use the lowest setting as it gets very cold. I have to use a blanket. My kids have nicknamed this fan “the blizzard” trust me you will not regret buying this fan it kind of works too well! The base is kind of large but I’m used to it.
customer_reviews.author: tami

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Great fan for the value. It is definitely loud but I like white noise at night and this fan is only used in our room. I would not use it in a living room or anywhere else tv-watching or conversation is happening. Knocking off a star because ours did NOT come with an instruction manual which tells you how to put it together so I had to search the internet for a tutorial because I couldn’t figure it out after 20 minutes of trying without one
customer_reviews.author: Colton & Jayna

customer_reviews.title: Yes to this fan!
customer_reviews.text: Works well, was extremely easy to put together pretty self expanitory. The noise level is good for me because I love the steady hum of a fan but not so crazy that I have to crank up the TV and can still talk on the phone. Good height varience, not wobbly, and the force of air on high is definitely relieving without AC.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great performance for a low price
customer_reviews.text: This fan was a reasonable price, it is plastic (the down side) but it's over all impact is pretty good. The fan/screen area are larger then the other fans we have that are roughly the same build. I have a fan similar but all metal and this plastic fan is way more powerful. It snaps together quickly and shouldn't be hard to snap apart for cleaning. It's light enough to move around and has been working well with my Alexa Tantan sockets
customer_reviews.author: M&GManning

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for - loud and breezy
customer_reviews.text: This fan is loud - which is exactly what I was hoping for. Working 3rd shift and sleeping during the day, I wanted a louder fan in my bedroom. This fits the bill. It creates an excellent output of airflow - it provides a great relief in the current heatwave we've been having. It was extremely easy to put together (once I realized I put the extension pole in the wrong way) and required no tools. I have no complaints. If you desire a quieter fan however, this may not be the one for you.
customer_reviews.author: VAM

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent fan. Assembly is required but nothing too tedious and no tools are involved. It stands about 4 1/2 ft from floor to the top. It is much bigger than I anticipated. It has a very wide swept range and 3 speeds. I keep mine on low and it is more than sufficient. It isn't a quiet fan and the higher speeds are noisier. I'd say noise on low is equivalent to the high noise on a box fan. Overall I love the look, performance, and power this fan offers.
customer_reviews.author: Koenigs

customer_reviews.title: Missing Parts and Cheaply Made
customer_reviews.text: I will not buy another Lasko fan again. I had one for years. Worked great and ran well. I ordered another when my old fan quit. The replacement was cheaply made (manufactured). The front grille was missing. I contacted the manufacturer/distributor. They sent a replacement. It was not a match. The back grille tabs would not work with it. Even if I got it to work I question how long it would last. I contacted Amazon for a REFUND and now have to pack it up and return to the UPS store. I will buy another fan, but it will not be this type and from this manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: One of My Best Father's Day Gift

customer_reviews.title: I am happy.
customer_reviews.text: Bought another one to replace smaller standing fan. It is a nice fan. My room needed it and it's good to hear that I am not the only one that likes to sleep listening to it. Blows my smaller standing fan away and I can actually feel the air now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: FANtastic
customer_reviews.text: Great fan it pushes air well. I bought it for the fan noise so the sound dosent bother me. Even on the lowest setting its noisy but thats what i got it for. Mine did not come with a remote but who cares, id lose it anyways.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Affordable fan, but some reliability issues.
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty loud fan and that's what we want. We typically leave our fan run 90 percent of the time and our Lasco fans usually last approximately 3 years before they stop working though. It puts out a good bit of air and it's incredibly affordable as well, so until there's something more reliable on the market this will have to suffice.
customer_reviews.author: JamesonMcG

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase
customer_reviews.text: The fan is pretty quiet when its on the lower speeds, however, once on high it does have a bit louder sound. It is nice for those of us who like the “background” noise though! There are 3 different speeds and the fan head is adjustable, which makes it great to aim exactly where you want it. It also oscillates. overall, it was a great purchase and helps keep the room nice and cool!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Diehl

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Just came this morning I put this together in 10 min or less without booklet. I plug this puppy in Iet it go and turn to number 3 also it moving the curtains and feel so good. If you have hot flashes at night ladies put on your side of the bed dream away. I don't think it loud just white noise only thing base is wide has the fan. Quick note base and shield is hard plastic everything else is metal.
customer_reviews.author: Gayle

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this fan
customer_reviews.text: This works like an industrial fan and it's tall as well. On the lowest speed, it's relatively quiet. We keep this in our bedroom and because I sleep with ear plugs, I don't hear it at all. This works better than some of the $100+ fans that we've owned. I've had it for 2 months now and I would definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: D. Caldwell

customer_reviews.title: Good fan, serves its purpose well. Keeps me cool at night. I’m happy
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Lasko fan and it’s a good quality fan for a reasonable price. It’s quite easy to assemble and operate and it’s not too loud, rather soothing when it’s on. I’d definitely recommend this product we use both every night and the first one we purchased more than 3 years ago, and it’s still works well. It’s pretty easy to disassemble for cleaning and quick to reassemble. It’s designed well and goes with any style
customer_reviews.author: Krystal

customer_reviews.title: my favorite fan
customer_reviews.text: this is my favorite fan out of all other brans,,,i dont reallly care about a remote control,,no it did not come with one,,,what i liked was the amount of circulation and how reliable and long it lasted above other brands
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best!
customer_reviews.text: Love this fan! It moves more air an any other fan we've had when on its highest speed. It is very versatile--offering three speeds, stationary and oscillating options, tilting fan head and adjustable heights. The base is wide and stable, and the fan can be easily detached to make it easy to move to another location. I know it's just a fan, but it is more attractive than most other utilitarian fans on the market. I keep this fan in front of my treadmill, but it would be useful almost anywhere. After using this fan, I will never consider buying a floor or box fan again.
customer_reviews.author: N.G. "Kundanancy"

customer_reviews.title: ACE
customer_reviews.text: Best way to hide outside conversations is to turn this fan on as it blocks nosy neighbors from listening to private conversations out. The fan works great, keep me cool and so far, have had no problems. I’m going on running full time, day and night almost one year of ownership. For price paid, can’t beat this fan, it’s good.
customer_reviews.author: SY214Top Contributor: Sewing

customer_reviews.title: Will buy again and again!
customer_reviews.text: This is hands down the best fan we have ever had!!!! Our bedroom was previously impossible to get to a comfortable temp. Even the central air didn't seem to reach it with the vents open all the way. With this fan I have had to cover myself because I WAS COLD!!!! 💕
customer_reviews.author: Zelda X. Pinwheel

customer_reviews.title: Not terrible
customer_reviews.text: It moves a good amount of air around which I like. I just don’t like how loud it is because I have to turn it off to hear tv etc. But it’s not too loud to sleep through it so not such a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: chase

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I bought this fan for my bedroom. I am one of those that can't sleep without a fan running through the night. The Lasko 1827 fan got the job done. It has a constant "purr" that helps me sleep. It is not too loud nor too quit. My only issue is the fan is larger then I expected. It sticks out like a sore thumb in my bedroom. I have since moved it to the shop and purchased a table fan for my bedroom. Five stars, because I should have checked measurements before buying. My husband loves it in the shop and it does a great job keeping him cool while working on projects in the summer.
customer_reviews.author: Tenny

customer_reviews.title: Good but Could Use a Lower Speed
customer_reviews.text: This is a simple floor fan without a remote control. It was easy to assemble. I have had many of them, most worked well, and this one is as good as most of them. Like most of them, this fan doesn’t have a low enough setting. It does not have a handle at the top to move the fan and you have to grip it by the pole below the fan to move it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A Bell

customer_reviews.title: Bad buy
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed in this fan. The plastic was cheap and it took forever to complete the assembly. Once completed, I moved the fan, causing it to tilt, and the screw on part behind the blades came loose. I could hear the noise of the blades hitting that part. I somehow managed to disassemble and reassemble. Same result. I packed it up the day that I received it and sent it back. Horrible, cheap product.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Almanza

customer_reviews.title: Cheap materials but effective fan
customer_reviews.text: On the plus side this fan puts out some great airflow, you can easily raise/lower the height, it offers a rotating head, and there are 3 fan speed options. On the downside (outside of the motor and cord) all the parts are plastic -- and when you handle them they seem like really cheap plastic. In addition, you have to put it all together. I've seen this being sold at big box stores for $40. It's not worth that, but for around $25 you'll get a fan that does the job.
customer_reviews.author: That Helpful Dad

customer_reviews.title: It's loud, but that's what we wanted.
customer_reviews.text: It works great, it's powerful. Even on level one it's pretty loud, but we wanted that to drown out the sounds of kittens parkour-ing around the living room at night.
customer_reviews.author: Lulu | Danny

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth the money!!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had for 5 months and it works great! Was easy to assemble. It’s a fan, so, of course it makes noise on high level but not annoyingly. I bought the Asurion insurance, just in case. I am buying another one. From my experience it is definitely worth spending the extra $10-15 for this one than the $15-$18 fans!!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Martin

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this same fan on a local store, but with our lovely temperature here in the caribbean we needed another one. Lasko are the most reliable fans I know. I doesn't come with a remote control (for those wondering), but you don't really need it. The only downside it has (but I may not be the manufactures fault, we will see) is that the base sometimes falls when I am moving it from one room to the other. It's not that often tho. Will update if anything else happens!
customer_reviews.author: Genesis V. Maymi

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fan for 300 sq ft room
customer_reviews.text: Ok...I'd said no more plastic fans... until I bought this one. Lightweight yet a sturdy floor design, easy to assemble and manages to cool a room (300 square ft) quickly. A little noisy on high speed but on lower speed it is just a 'white noise' that I don't find offensive. I may purchase another this summer.
customer_reviews.author: DBHawaii

customer_reviews.title: So strong
customer_reviews.text: I am always warm so I use my fan year round in the morning getting ready. This fan is so strong I have never used higher than the first setting. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Pandora

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Works great!-until it broke a year later
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! Easy to put together, has a nice sound. I like the fan sound on when I sleep, so this fan is perfect because it’s not too loud, nor too quiet. Gives off great wind-much better than the last fan I had! Lowered my 5 star to 3 stars. It broke last week! So it lasted one year. It was great while it worked but something in the motor broke and we can’t seem to fix it.
customer_reviews.author: Katy

customer_reviews.title: Cool in the heat and humidity on our patio when umbrella is open
customer_reviews.text: Bought this fan to use on our patio together with our umbrella open. If fan is directed at chest height it does a good job deflecting the heat. Before buying this lasko 18 inch blade fan I borrowed a larger blade fan. I did not think the biggest wind at its highest level Was comfortable It was the right choice to buy the 18 inch Lasko
customer_reviews.author: donald schumacher

customer_reviews.title: Blew me away!
customer_reviews.text: YES this fan is everything I wanted. I had one of those floor fans that doesn’t do much but blow a little air that cost $60. This fan is is so amazing and strong. I also like that It produces a loud noise that’s not irritating this way I can block out any noise outside of my room or coming from my room. Would recommend to anyone looking for a fan to actually do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: great for your home.
customer_reviews.text: oh my God i just love this fan it's everything it's the bomb dot come i bought this for my boys room and the loved it i will definitely be ordering another one very soon and i will recommend this product to everyone
customer_reviews.author: lucy

customer_reviews.title: Broken knob the first week.
customer_reviews.text: We use these type of fans every day, we turn them on at night as I like the sound and breeze. Unfortunately, the on/off knob fell off the first week of use. We also had to use WD40 to stop a squeeking sound. I was going to turn it but I threw the box away. Hopefully they will at least send us a replacement knob.
customer_reviews.author: Linam g

customer_reviews.title: Great fan
customer_reviews.text: Love this brand of fan. This one is as great as the others I have purchased. Noisier than the others I owned. Could not get the front of the fan guard on. Still I recommend this fan to everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Joann L. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it... very cheap
customer_reviews.text: This is a very cheap fan. The cage that surrounds the blades is made of plastic and is very hard to snap together. If the plastic is bent any way, it will all just snap off. Definitely not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Casey M

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Fan stand would not let the fan stay at any height but low, it kept falling down to low. I after trying to get it to a certain height broke the thing you twist to hold the fan up. I brought this because we ha one at work, we don't use a lot, but it does the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: Fondlelak

customer_reviews.title: instead of cooling, it went up in FLAMES
customer_reviews.text: have to give a 1 star rating due to the fact that I bought this fan and had it shipped to my son that is serving in Iraq, he plugged it in and within 3 minutes it began smoking very heavily and before he could unplug it, it burst out into flames, burning the wall behind it and having to be put out with fire distinguisher, not what this army mom liked hearing when asked if he received his package, just thankful no one was injured
customer_reviews.author: jerri lowe

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Decent fan. Works well. Assembles in 3 minutes. I had a dark gray metal fan before. Might just be me, but thought the metal one looked better cosmetically. Do over, might have looked a little harder for metal one. This one looks just fine though and am generally happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Guy

customer_reviews.title: Too Loud
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to like but can’t. To loud for bedroom. Like white noise to fall asleep but this is to loud and prevents one from falling asleep. Would cost to much to return so will be giving it away.
customer_reviews.author: MICHELLE AUSTIN

customer_reviews.title: Love Lasko brand!
customer_reviews.text: Previously owned a Lasko fan for almost 20 years. Finally broke. Purchased this one and still very pleased with the brand. Good sturdy material with kids running around, the airflow is great, and the noise level is perfect if you like the sound of the fan while you sleep. I had a tiny bit of trouble getting the front on but really the set up was super simple.
customer_reviews.author: LittleRed

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: The material is mostly just a thick plastic on the top and bottom, and the pole is a light metal. The head of the fan is much larger than i expected. When assembling the bottom you just put the pole through the base and so sometimes when you pick it up, it slides out. The lowest setting is too powerful for my liking, so I would rather use it in hotter weather.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Great fan
customer_reviews.text: I love this fan; it is much more powerful than tower fans and does a great job at keeping you cool even on the lower settings. It is also a lot noisier than tower ans, which I personally like but others may not. Easy assembly.
customer_reviews.author: PatradTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Everything was as expected
customer_reviews.text: The fan I received was what you would expect in a fan. It's not quiet, but it's definitely not comparable to a helicopter as I've seen in other reviews. The assembly could've gone smoother, but everything fit together just fine with a little extra manipulation. We've been keeping it on the first setting because even that is strong enough to keep our average sized bedroom nice and cool. Five stars for doing exactly what a fan should do 👍
customer_reviews.author: Sasha1103

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy! Made of cheap materials!
customer_reviews.text: I just got 2 of these fans, used once and one already broken. I tried to adjust the height and the piece used to release the bar just split in half while I was turning it. It's made of plastic not metal! Why? Awful. The head piece ended up falling on my arms. I'm actually trying to tape or glue together because I need a fan. Ugh! Don't buy! I want my money back!!!
customer_reviews.author: L2Stella

product_meta.title: Lasko 1827 18″ Elegance & Performance Adjustable Pedestal Fan, Black - Features Oscillating Movement Tilt-back Fan Head
product_meta.description:
This elegantly designed pedestal fan from Lasko blends into surrounding decor and cools the largest home spaces. Features adjustable height, oscillation, and 3 quiet speeds to create powerful airflow in your fitness studio or large living space.

Additional features include:

 * Adjustable height
 * Tilt-back fan head
 * 3 quiet, energy-efficient speeds
 * Made in the USA from domestic & imported parts
 * The Blue Plug™ Patented safety fuse technology
 * Simple no-tools assembly
feature_bullets: 3 Quiet, Energy-Efficient Speeds - allows this free standing pedestal fan to provide a cooling breeze around the home or home office. With a portable design, this fan is ideal for the bedroom, living room, or near your desk. Low, medium, and high speed make this fan well suited around the whole house.

Adjustable Height & Tilt-back Head - give you the ability to direct the cooling air right where you need it. The fan's stand or pedestal, adjusts up or down changing the fan's height from 38 to 54.5 inch while the tilt-back head lets you aim the air towards the floor, ceiling, or anywhere in between.

Widespread Oscillation - describes the action of the fan head moving from side to side to blow air throughout the area. Oscillation allows for the fan to provide ventilation for a wide area. This makes the fan great for large rooms.

Blue Plug Patented Safety Fuse Technology - this built-in safety feature places a fuse directly in the plug of the power cord. If the fuse detects a potentially hazardous electrical fault it will cut off electric current to the fan, preventing a potential safety hazard. Extension/Depth-2 inch. Backplate/Canopy Width-4.25 inch. Backplate/Canopy Length-24 inch. Backplate/Canopy Thickness-0.81 inch

Simple No Tools Assembly - means you'll have your fan assembled in no time. Simply follow the included instructions to assemble the base mount to the extension pipe, fan blades and grill and you're done. This fan is both metal and plastic. The motor and other parts are metal, while other parts are plastic

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars4,957 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
